It seems a lot of people are confused...
So to alleviate the confused and/or angry forum posts, hopefully this breakdown will help...

DISCLAIMER: I rounded percents to the nearest whole percent so they may be a fraction of a percent more or less than the percent I listed (assuming I did my math correctly)

**Current Model:**

_Monday:_ 3 champs, 3 skins go on sale

_Friday:_ 3 champs, 3 skins go on sale

_Ultimate skin release:_ x% discount sale at release, never goes on sale again

_Legendary skin release:_ no sale , never goes on sale

_1350 skin release:_ released at 28% discount for a week then goes back to full price, wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

_975 skin release:_ no sale , wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

_750 skin release:_ no sale , wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

**New Model:**

_Monday:_ 4 champs, 4 skins go on sale

_Friday:_ 4 champs, 4 skins go on sale

_Ultimate skin release:_ no sale on release, 4 - 6 months goes on early sale for 25% discount then goes back to full price, never goes on a direct discount sale again

_Legendary skin release:_ no sale on release, 4 - 6 months goes on early sale for 26% discount then goes back to full price, never goes on a direct discount sale again

_1350 skin release:_ no sale on release, 4 - 6 months goes on early sale for 28% discount then goes back to full price, wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

_975 skin release:_ no sale on release, 4 - 6 months goes on early sale for 21% discount then goes back to full price, wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

_750 skin release:_ no sale on release, 4 - 6 months goes on early sale for 32% discount then goes back to full price, wait approx. 1 year from release for 50% off sale

**These early sales _DO NOT_ apply to Legacy skins, or to previously released Ultimate and Legendary skins**

I don't think you guys understand what's going on here......

The recent "PROJECT: First Strike" thing was an experiment to see what it would take to get people to buy things immediately at no discount (not much apparently). Now we're just losing the release discounts altogether in favor of this new.......wait 4-6 months system. On paper it looks good because legendary skins will go on "sale" now and we have to wait a little less for 975 and 750 content.....but the reality of it is that they're holding the quality content, the 1350+ tier stuff, hostage to try and tempt people into spending that extra money to have them first because they know that's the stuff people want. If it were a true 50% sale that'd be one thing but what this is is them effectively eliminating the release discount. (that release "discount" for ultimate skins continues to go up and up....)

I used to be totally supportive of buying full price skins back in 2012....I remember a rioter saying that quality would go up but 975 would stay the standard.... Then it all changed when they hired Hippalus and he started masking markups as deals (remember that atrocity when the 1350 tier was introduced and he tried to make it sound ok because all of these skins nobody buys are getting cheaper?)

The way it's looking now I will not be buying another skin at launch once 2016 hits.....I encourage other people to follow suit too but....apparently all it takes to change your minds is a loading screen border.

Wait, you're saying Hippalus, the guy who promised a survey for Limited Edition skin owners to express how they felt about them bringing the skins back and who hasn't delivered it for 2 years, lied?! WOAH!

But yeah, seriously, I was all for Hippalus when he first got hired. Then he started doing stuff like bringing LE skins back, increasing prices, not actually coming up with any solutions, and just doing anything to get money for Riot without considering players. Really a shame too... I miss supporting Riot.

As someone who was promised limited edition skins were truly limited edition, and spent money specifically for this reason, only to have it half-heartedly refunded (in riot points, not dollars) sans interest, 2 years after the purchase, I have to say I agree with the above poster. For shame Rito.

I remember all of this and I feel your pain man but it's my own fault for abusing my wallet even though I saw the warning signs at the release of Mecha Kha'Zix, and even during the rise of the 1350 skins... Well time to stop being and idiot and lock up my wallet I hope you guys do the same.

(My opinion won't change much but I hope we all get the best deal for all of us, if the line isn't drawn at some point next thing we know these so called "early" sales will be replaced by an even "better" system they will come up with).

So how many cool things exist that people will buy on release without a discount? Does Fallout 4 ring a bell? Everybody knows it will be buggy and fairly unpolished given Bethesda's track record, but damn it all if everybody didn't buy it anyway.
